post_detail.description:
What this case study demonstrates: 
Our ability to launch a fully-integrated marketing campaign for a television show. 
Our ability to efficiently produce a high volume of content across media. 

Challenge:
USA Network, looking to promote the fourth season of their TV series “The 
4400”, worked with Campfire and Click3x for a multi-platform campaign 
aimed at exiting existing viewers as well as piquing interest in a new 
audience. 

Execution:
Promicin is a fictional substance featured in the series that either kills those
 who inject it, or gives them super-human abilities. Campfire and 
Click3x launched “The Battle Over Promicin”, a multi-platform campaign 
that debated the use of this fictional drug as if it were real news. 
Click3x produced over 40 videos, dozens of blog and rich media banners, 3
 websites as well as wild postings. The campaign evolved after the 
initial launch and many additional elements were fed itno the campaign 
as the audience responded, including  additional viral websites, videos,
 wild postings, and interactive banners. 

Results
The campaign successfully drove attention for both ardent fans as well as attracted new viewers. 
Click 3X successfully produced a high volume of branded content across media in a short time frame and very cost-efficiently.  
The campaign went viral, being spread through hardcore fans and picked up by traditional media sources.
